result.execSummary:
The defendant John T Matter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
2:45 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John T Matter in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for John T Matter. Atty. Bucher advises upfront restitution has been paid so matter should be able to proceed to plea and sentencing today.  State confirms.  Court recites the offer.  Both defense and the state confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Counts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in.


Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Bucher.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $416.00 (includes DV surcharge);
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:52 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John T Matter in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for John T Matter.  Atty Bucher advises parties are prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing, but that included payment of upfront restitution.  Atty. Bucher notes his client has the restitution but it is a personal check which the DA's office will not accept.  Atty. Bucher lays out some options of how to proceed.  Atty. Hoffmann would like to just set plea and sentencing over to a new date based on the offer.  Atty. Bucher requests a new plea and sentencing date as soon as possible.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by Atty. Bucher requesting to have the 8/15/2022 hearing converted to plea and sentencing. **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - approved**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
